«~Non est Deus.~»^ The fool said in his: et abominábiles facti sunt in iniqụitátibus~; non est qụi fáçiat bonum. ^ They are corrupted
"There is no God.": and become abominable in iniquities~; there is none that doth good.

1 ^ Dixit insápiens in corde suo: 3 ^ Deus de caĕlo prospèxit super fílios hòminum
"There is no God.": aŭt reqụírens Deum. ^ God looked down from heaven on the children of men
column4: to see if there were any that did understand

1 ^ Dixit insápiens in corde suo: 4 ^ Òmnes declinavérunt~; sìmul inútiles facti sunt~; non est qụi fáçiat bonum
«~Non est Deus.~»^ The fool said in his: non est usqụe ad unum. ^ All have gone aside~; they are become unprofitable together~; there is none that doth good
qụi dévorant plebem meam ut cìbum panis~? ^ Shall not all the workers of iniquity know
"There is no God.": who eat up my people as they eat bread~?

1 ^ Dixit insápiens in corde suo: 6 ^ Deum non invocavérunt~; illic trepidavérunt timóre
«~Non est Deus.~»^ The fool said in his: ubi non èrat tìmor. Qụóniam Deus dissipávit òssua eórum qụi homìnibus placent~; confúsi sunt
"There is no God.": qụóniam Deus sprevit eos. ^ They have not called upon God~; there have they trembled for fear
column4: where there was no fear. For God hath scattered the bones of them that please men~; they have been confounded

1 ^ Dixit insápiens in corde suo: 7 ^ ¿~Qụìs dabit ex Sióne salutáre Israhélis~? Qụum convertúerit Deus captivitátem plebis suaĕ
"There is no God.": et laĕtábitur Isráhel. ^ Who will give out of Sion the salvation of Israel~? When God shall bring back the captivity of his people
